course.description_en: Discover all the amazing ways people and things travel from place to place. Learn about cars, buses, trains, planes, and boats while exploring how they help us move around the world.
course.description_ar: اكتشف جميع الطرق المذهلة التي ينتقل بها الناس والأشياء من مكان إلى آخر. تعلم عن السيارات والحافلات والقطارات والطائرات والقوارب واستكشف كيف تساعدنا في التنقل حول العالم.
course.subject: science

lessons.title_ar: السيارات تسير بصوت فروم على الطرق

content_data.title: Charlie Car's Daily Adventures
content_data.content: Meet Charlie Car! Charlie is red and shiny. Cars have four round wheels. Wheels roll and roll! Cars drive on roads. Roads are like paths for cars. Charlie says 'Vroom, vroom!' when he drives. Cars take people to many places. To the store! To grandma's house! To the park! Charlie has a driver who sits inside. The driver uses a steering wheel to turn left and right. Cars need gas to go. Gas makes cars move! At night, Charlie turns on his headlights. Headlights help him see in the dark. Charlie is careful and drives slowly. Safety first for Charlie Car!
learning_objectives: Identify cars as vehicles that drive on roads
Understand basic car parts and how they work
Learn about car safety and careful driving

vocabulary_words.definition: Vehicle with four wheels that drives on roads
Round things under cars that roll to make them move
Special paths where cars drive
Person who makes the car go and stop
Round thing driver turns to make car go left or right
Bright lights on front of car for seeing in dark

content_data.parent_guidance: Show child toy cars and let them roll them on makeshift roads. Point out car parts like wheels and windows. Make 'vroom' sounds together. If possible, show real car outside and point out parts safely from distance.
safety_notes: Use only large toy cars appropriate for age
Keep car play on safe, flat surfaces
Never let child play with real car keys
Ensure no small car parts that could be choking hazards
Always emphasize that cars are driven by grown-ups only
discussion_questions: What sound does a car make?
How many wheels does a car have?
Where do cars drive?

extension_activities.title: Car Racing Game
extension_activities.description: Race toy cars on cardboard 'tracks' while making car sounds.

extension_activities.title: Car Wash Play
extension_activities.description: Pretend to wash toy cars with sponges and water (supervised).

content_data.title: Benny Bus's Important Job
content_data.content: Meet Benny Bus! He is big and yellow. Buses are much bigger than cars! Benny has many windows and many seats inside. People sit in the seats. Buses carry lots of people at the same time. That's Benny's special job! School buses take children to school. City buses take grown-ups to work. Benny has a big door that opens and closes. People get on and off the bus. Benny drives slowly and carefully. He stops at bus stops. Bus stops are special places where people wait. Let's pretend to be on a bus! Sit in your seats! Hold on tight! Here we go!
learning_objectives: Understand buses are bigger than cars and carry many people
Learn about different types of buses and their jobs
Practice bus safety and behavior

vocabulary_words.definition: Big vehicle that carries many people at the same time
Places where people sit inside the bus
People who ride in the bus
Special place where people wait for the bus
Yellow bus that takes children to school
Bus that takes people around the city

materials_needed: Yellow paper or toy school bus
content_data.parent_guidance: Set up chairs in rows like bus seats. Let child practice getting 'on' and 'off' the bus safely. Emphasize sitting quietly and holding on. Talk about bus safety rules like waiting for the bus to stop completely.
safety_notes: Ensure chairs are stable and won't tip
Practice safe 'boarding' and 'exiting' movements
Emphasize real bus safety rules
Keep pretend bus play controlled and calm
Always have adult supervision during bus role-play
discussion_questions: How is a bus different from a car?
What color are school buses?
Where do people wait for the bus?

extension_activities.title: Bus Route Game
extension_activities.description: Create pretend bus route with stops around the house.

extension_activities.title: Wheels on the Bus Song
extension_activities.description: Sing the classic song with actions and movements.

content_data.title: Tommy Train's Long Journey
content_data.content: Meet Tommy Train! He is long and strong. Trains are made of many cars connected together. The front car is called the engine. The engine pulls all the other cars! Tommy runs on special tracks called railroad tracks. Tracks are like roads but only for trains. Tommy says 'Choo-choo!' and 'Chug-chug-chug!' He has a loud whistle that goes 'Toot-toot!' Tommy carries people and packages to faraway places. Some trains carry people. Some trains carry food and toys to stores. Tommy crosses bridges over rivers. He goes through tunnels under mountains. Trains are very long and very strong!
learning_objectives: Understand trains run on tracks and are made of connected cars
Learn about train sounds and how they travel
Discover what trains carry and where they go

vocabulary_words.definition: Long vehicle made of cars connected together that runs on tracks
Special metal roads that trains run on
Front part of train that pulls all the other cars
Loud sound trains make to warn people
Boxes and things that trains carry from place to place
Long hole through a mountain that trains can go through

content_data.parent_guidance: Show how train cars connect together. Let child pull toy train along makeshift tracks. Make train sounds together - 'choo-choo' and 'toot-toot'. Explain how trains are different from cars and buses.
safety_notes: Use only safe toy trains with no small detachable parts
Ensure string/tracks are not tripping hazards
Keep whistle/noisemaker at safe volume
Supervise all train play activities
Teach that real trains are dangerous and to stay away from tracks
discussion_questions: What sound does a train make?
Where do trains travel?
What pulls the train cars?

extension_activities.title: Train Building
extension_activities.description: Connect boxes with string to make a long pretend train.

extension_activities.title: Train Station Play
extension_activities.description: Set up pretend train station with tickets and departure announcements.

content_data.title: Amy Airplane Soars Through Clouds
content_data.content: Meet Amy Airplane! She flies high up in the sky. Airplanes have big wings that help them fly. Wings spread out wide like bird wings! Amy has a propeller that spins round and round. Or big engines that push her through the air. Amy flies above the clouds! She can see the whole world from up there. Houses look tiny! Cars look like toys! Amy takes people on trips to faraway places. People sit inside Amy and look out the windows. Flying is faster than driving! Let's pretend to be airplanes! Spread your arms like wings! Make airplane sounds! Fly around the room carefully!
learning_objectives: Understand airplanes fly in the sky using wings
Learn how airplanes look different from ground vehicles
Practice airplane movements safely

vocabulary_words.definition: Flying machine with wings that travels through the sky
Long flat parts that help airplanes fly
Move through the air like birds and airplanes
Spinning part on front of some airplanes
Parts that give airplanes power to fly
White fluffy things in the sky that airplanes fly through

content_data.parent_guidance: Show child how to spread arms like wings and 'fly' safely around room. Make airplane sounds together. Demonstrate how paper airplanes glide through air. Point out real airplanes in sky if visible.
safety_notes: Ensure safe, clear space for airplane movements
Keep 'flying' movements controlled and gentle
Watch for obstacles that child might run into
Use only safe toy airplanes with no sharp parts
Supervise paper airplane activities
Emphasize that only real airplanes can fly, not people
discussion_questions: What helps airplanes fly?
Where do airplanes travel?
How do you move like an airplane?

extension_activities.title: Paper Airplane Fun
extension_activities.description: Watch adult make paper airplanes and see how they glide.

extension_activities.title: Airport Play
extension_activities.description: Set up pretend airport with check-in and boarding activities.

content_data.title: Bobby Boat's Water Adventures
content_data.content: Meet Bobby Boat! He floats on top of water. Boats don't have wheels like cars. They have hulls that sit in the water. Water holds the boat up! Some boats have sails that catch the wind. Wind pushes the boat forward! Some boats have motors that make them go. Motor boats go 'putt-putt-putt!' Big ships carry lots of people across oceans. Small boats take people fishing. Bobby can go on rivers, lakes, and oceans. He rocks gently on the waves. Boats need to stay on water to work. Let's test what floats! Put different things in water. See what floats like a boat!
learning_objectives: Understand boats float on water instead of rolling on roads
Learn about different types of boats and how they move
Experiment with floating and sinking

vocabulary_words.definition: Vehicle that floats on water to carry people or things
Stay on top of water without sinking
Bottom part of boat that sits in the water
Big pieces of cloth that catch wind to move boats
Machine that makes boats go fast
Water that moves up and down in the ocean

materials_needed: Large bowl or tub with water
Various safe objects to test floating
content_data.parent_guidance: Supervise all water activities closely. Let child gently place objects in water to see what floats. Explain why some things float and others sink in simple terms. Keep water activities controlled and have towels ready.
safety_notes: Always supervise water activities
Use shallow water only
Keep water containers stable
Have towels ready for spills
Use only safe, large objects for floating tests
Never leave child alone with water
discussion_questions: What makes boats different from cars?
Where do boats travel?
What happens when you put a boat in water?

extension_activities.title: Boat Building
extension_activities.description: Make simple boats from plastic containers and test if they float.

extension_activities.title: Floating Experiment
extension_activities.description: Test various household objects to see which ones float like boats.

content_data.title: Helper Vehicles Save the Day
content_data.content: Some vehicles have very special jobs! Meet the helper vehicles! Fire trucks are red and carry water. They help put out fires! Ambulances are white with red crosses. They take sick people to hospitals quickly! Police cars have flashing lights. They help keep everyone safe! Garbage trucks are big and strong. They pick up trash to keep our town clean! Tow trucks have special hooks. They help cars that are broken! Mail trucks bring letters to our houses! Each helper vehicle has a special job. They all work hard to help people every day. These vehicles have loud sirens that say 'Get out of the way! We're helping someone!'
learning_objectives: Learn about vehicles that have special jobs helping people
Understand how different vehicles serve the community
Recognize emergency and service vehicles

vocabulary_words.definition: Red vehicle that carries water to put out fires
Special vehicle that takes sick people to hospital
Vehicle that police officers drive to keep people safe
Big truck that picks up trash from houses
Vehicle that helps move broken cars
Loud sound emergency vehicles make

materials_needed: Toy emergency vehicles (fire truck, ambulance, police car)
content_data.parent_guidance: Show pictures of real helper vehicles and explain their jobs simply. Let child play with toy versions. Make siren sounds together but keep volume reasonable. Emphasize how these vehicles help people.
safety_notes: Keep siren sounds at safe volume levels
Use only safe toy vehicles
Explain that real emergency vehicles are not toys
Teach child to move aside when they hear real sirens
Keep emergency vehicle play positive and helpful
discussion_questions: What does a fire truck do?
Which vehicle takes sick people to the hospital?
What sound do emergency vehicles make?

extension_activities.title: Emergency Vehicle Parade
extension_activities.description: Line up toy emergency vehicles and 'drive' them to help people.

extension_activities.title: Community Helper Match
extension_activities.description: Match emergency vehicles to the community helpers who drive them.

content_data.title: What Transportation Do You Know?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun game about all the transportation we learned! I will ask you questions about cars, buses, trains, airplanes, boats, and special vehicles. You can point to pictures, make sounds, or tell me the answers!
learning_objectives: Review all transportation types learned
Practice identifying vehicles and their characteristics
Show understanding of how different vehicles work

vocabulary_words.definition: Fun game with questions about what you learned
All the different ways people and things travel

materials_needed: Pictures or toys of all vehicles learned
content_data.parent_guidance: Show pictures clearly and give child time to respond. Accept pointing, sounds, or words as answers. Make vehicle sounds together. Keep quiz interactive and fun rather than stressful.
safety_notes: Keep quiz atmosphere positive and encouraging
No pressure for perfect answers
Celebrate every response attempt
Take breaks if child seems tired
End on encouraging note
discussion_questions: Point to the vehicle with four wheels that goes 'vroom'!
Which vehicle is big and yellow and carries many children?
What runs on tracks and says 'choo-choo'?
Which vehicle flies in the sky with wings?
Point to the vehicle that floats on water!
What vehicle is red and helps put out fires?
Make the sound a car makes!
Show me how an airplane flies!
Where do boats travel?
Which vehicles help people in emergencies?

extension_activities.title: Transportation Sound Game
extension_activities.description: Make sounds of different vehicles while others guess which one.

extension_activities.title: Vehicle Movement Dance
extension_activities.description: Move like different vehicles - drive, fly, float, chug along tracks.

content_data.title: Our Amazing Transportation Journey
content_data.content: Let's celebrate all the amazing transportation we learned about! We discovered cars that go 'vroom' on roads with their four wheels. We learned about big buses that carry many people to school and work. We met trains that chug along tracks saying 'choo-choo' and pulling many cars. We flew with airplanes high in the sky with their big wings spread wide. We floated with boats on water, rocking gently on the waves. We helped people with special vehicles like fire trucks, ambulances, and police cars. Every vehicle has a special job! Cars take families places. Buses carry lots of people. Trains travel long distances. Airplanes fly to faraway places. Boats sail on water. Helper vehicles keep us safe! You know so much about transportation now! Let's take an imaginary trip using all our vehicles!
learning_objectives: Review all transportation types and their characteristics
Understand how different vehicles serve different purposes
Celebrate learning about the world of transportation

vocabulary_words.definition: Be very happy about something wonderful you learned
Trip from one place to another
Found out about and learned new things
Pretend trip in your mind
Special job that something is meant to do
All the ways people and things move from place to place

materials_needed: All toy vehicles from previous lessons
content_data.parent_guidance: Set up 'transportation stations' around room with different vehicles. Let child 'travel' to each station and play with that type of vehicle. Make it feel like a real adventure. Take photos if desired to remember their transportation learning.
safety_notes: Ensure all play areas are safe and clear
Supervise movement between 'stations'
Keep all vehicles and materials safe
Manage excitement levels appropriately
Take breaks during long celebration if needed
discussion_questions: Which vehicle was your favorite to learn about?
If you could travel anywhere, which vehicle would you choose?
How do all these vehicles help people?
What was the most fun part about learning transportation?

extension_activities.title: Transportation Book
extension_activities.description: Create simple book with drawings or pictures of all vehicles learned.

extension_activities.title: Dream Trip Planning
extension_activities.description: Plan imaginary trip using different vehicles to get to dream destination.

extension_activities.title: Transportation Expert Badge
extension_activities.description: Make special badge showing child is now a transportation expert.
